title: INtech
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Pro-Israel hacktivist group claims reponsibility for alleged Iranian bank hack
items.description: The apparent cyberattack comes as Israel and Iran engage in a days-long escalating military conflict.

items.title: Applied Intuition raises $600 million as it pushes further into defense
items.description: The buzzy AI-powered autonomous vehicle software company doubles its valuation from last year -- and then some.

items.title: How Private Equity Killed the American Dream

items.title: Facebook announces that all videos on its platform will soon be shared as reels
items.description: Facebook announced on Tuesday that all videos on its platform will soon be shared as reels, regardless of their length or orientation.

items.title: Intel to lay off up to 20% of Intel Foundry workers
items.description: Rumors of these layoffs began back in April as Intel looks to refocus on its core business units and shed additional bloat.

items.title: Try This Free Version of Microsoft Office That Runs in Your Browser
items.description: If you can't afford Microsoft’s $150 suite of office tools, there’s a web-based version that’s free to use—and nearly just as capable.

items.title: What Type of Mattress Is Right for You? (2025)
items.description: Here’s how to pick the best mattress for your sleep needs, straight from a professional mattress tester.

items.title: Gardyn Indoor Hydroponic Garden Review: Better Growing Through AI
items.description: Even those with the blackest thumbs can become master gardeners—as long as they’re willing to shell out for a subscription.

items.title: Unlock purpose-driven growth at TechCrunch All Stage, and get $210 off for 6 more days

items.title: Best Open Earbuds, Tested and Reviewed (2025): Bose and More
items.description: These wireless earbuds with an “open” design let you zone out to your music while also keeping aware of your surroundings.
